docs.title: Backup and Restore
docs.description: A 3-2-1 backup strategy is recommended to protect your data. You should keep copies of your uploaded photos/videos as well as the Wizarr database for a comprehensive backup solution. This page provides an overview on how to backup the database and the location of user-uploaded pictures and videos. A template bash script that can be run as a cron job is provided here

docs.description: Wizarr supports the option to send notifications via Email for the following events:

docs.title: Jobs and Workers
docs.description: Workers

docs.title: OAuth Authentication
docs.description: This page contains details about using OAuth in Wizarr.

docs.title: Pre-existing Postgres
docs.description: While not officially recommended, it is possible to run Wizarr using a pre-existing Postgres server. To use this setup, you should have a baseline level of familiarity with Postgres and the Linux command line. If you do not have these, we recommend using the default setup with a dedicated Postgres container.

docs.title: Reverse Proxy
docs.description: Users can deploy a custom reverse proxy that forwards requests to Wizarr. This way, the reverse proxy can handle TLS termination, load balancing, or other advanced features. All reverse proxies between Wizarr and the user must forward all headers and set the Host, X-Real-IP, X-Forwarded-Proto and X-Forwarded-For headers to their appropriate values. Additionally, your reverse proxy should allow for big enough uploads. By following these practices, you ensure that all custom reverse proxies are fully compatible with Wizarr.

docs.title: User Management
docs.description: Wizarr supports multiple users, each with their own library.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.description: Wizarr uses a traditional client-server design, with a dedicated database for data persistence. The frontend clients communicate with backend services over HTTP using REST APIs. Below is a high level diagram of the architecture.

docs.title: Database Migrations
docs.description: After making any changes in the server/src/entities, a database migration need to run in order to register the changes in the database. Follow the steps below to create a new migration.

docs.title: Database Queries
docs.description: Keep in mind that mucking around in the database might set the moon on fire. Avoid modifying the database directly when possible, and always have current backups.

docs.title: External Library
docs.description: This guide walks you through adding an External Library.

docs.title: Remote Access
docs.description: This page gives a few pointers on how to access your Wizarr instance from outside your LAN.

docs.title: Remote Machine Learning
docs.description: To alleviate performance issues on low-memory systems like the Raspberry Pi, you may also host Wizarr's machine learning container on a more powerful system, such as your laptop or desktop computer. The server container will send requests containing the image preview to the remote machine learning container for processing. The machine learning container does not persist this data or associate it with a particular user.

docs.title: Scaling Wizarr
docs.description: Wizarr is built with modern deployment practices in mind, and the backend is designed to be able to run multiple instances in parallel. When doing this, the only requirement you need to be aware of is that every instance needs to be connected to the shared infrastructure. That means they should all have access to the same Postgres and Redis instances, and have the same files mounted into the containers.

docs.title: SMTP settings using Gmail
docs.description: This guide walks you through how to get the information you need to set up your Wizarr instance to send emails using Gmail's SMTP server.

docs.title: Backup Script
docs.description: Borg is a feature-rich deduplicating archiving software with built-in versioning. We provide a template bash script that can be run daily/weekly as a cron job to back up your files and database. We encourage you to read the quick-start guide for Borg before running this script.
